meanings.definition: To climb up or over something
meanings.sent1: The cat was scaling the tree to catch a bird.
meanings.sent2: She carefully scaled the mountain to reach the summit.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was scaling the fence like a tiny acrobat.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was scaling new heights as she conquered the steep slope.
meanings.sent5: Scaling the wall, he felt a sense of accomplishment as he reached the top.

meanings.definition: To adjust the size of something
meanings.sent1: He was scaling down the image to fit it on the screen.
meanings.sent2: The tailor scaled the dress to perfectly fit the customer.
meanings.sent3: The chef was scaling the recipe to feed a smaller group.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was scaling up as she saw the project coming together.
meanings.sent5: Scaling the font size made the text easier to read for everyone.

meanings.definition: A series of levels or stages in a process
meanings.sent1: The scaling of difficulty in the game kept players engaged.
meanings.sent2: The scaling of prices made it difficult for people to afford basic necessities.
meanings.sent3: The scaling of the mountain of paperwork seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent4: The scaling of success in her career was a result of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The scaling of the company's growth was evident in its expanding reach.
